website_summaries.verdict: Contains 2 of the most recommended active ingredients, and works faster than pills for larger cats.
pros: Waterproof after application, will not wash away after bathing
Addresses fleas at all life stages
Safe for kittens as young as 8 weeks
cons: Some cats may be extremely sensitive to ingredients
Reports of re-infestation only weeks after treatment

customer_reviews.title: I’ve been using this product for many years with good results and no problems
customer_reviews.text: My complaint is not with the product in general, but with the seller. I’ve been using this product for many years with good results and no problems. However this recently received batch is bad. The silver packages that hold the vials arrived flat, and the vials open way too easily. This batch is not killing fleas, and (for the first time ever) has burned my cat’s neck and caused the hair to fall out. I don’t know if I got a bad batch, if it was stored improperly prior to shipment, or if they have been tampered with, but I am not happy and would like a refund.
customer_reviews.author: C. Herard

customer_reviews.title: We now have fleas
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product religiously every month purchased from a Pet store and my cats never had fleas. Since I bought 3 mos worth (for 2 cats) from here I had seen them scratching and this morning I saw a live flea in my house...which means there are many more. I am disgusted with myself that I did not continue to buy from pet retailer as I never had this problem before. I believe this product was counterfeit.
customer_reviews.author: DeeJayBee

customer_reviews.title: Avoid! Caused burn mark and loss of fur
customer_reviews.text: AVOID: This product caused what looks like a burn mark on my cat exactly where I applied it. There is prob a 2 inch patch of fur that is now completely bald. The 4 year old cat has never had any issues from Advantage II in the past. A week after I used it- Amazon emailed me telling me to immediately dispose of the rest of the medication. I contacted Amazon for more info and they couldn't (wouldn't?) explain the reason for recalling the medication. Im wondering if this product is even authentic. 100% avoid!
customer_reviews.author: TRUTH

customer_reviews.title: Our cat died from this horrible product...
customer_reviews.text: This product killed our pet. We are heartbroken. He began to act strange, lost all playfulness and appetite, within a day of taking it, and died shortly after. We applied it EXACTLY as instructed and our cat was given the correct dose for his weight. I would never use this product again. Our indoor cat was adopted from the local shelter and came to us infested with fleas - I don't know what else is available to treat fleas, or if other brands might be better, but as horrible as fleas are (we were all getting bites daily) I would NOT use this again. It sure did kill the fleas - and took our pet with it. TOXIC. BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Rellik

customer_reviews.title: Please do not purchase - horrible for cats
customer_reviews.text: I used Advantage II for the first time on my cat and within hours the fur on the back of her neck fell out. It's been 3 days and she has a bloody, bald patch of skin. I've taken her to the vet twice now and spent over $600 trying to help with the pain and discomfort. She has never had this type of reaction to the previous formula. I feel awful for putting this on her, and after seeing other reviews I realize this has happened to other users. Unfortunately this product is non-returnable so it was an expensive mistake and an awful experience for my cat.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn D.

customer_reviews.title: Something changed!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for years on my cats and has always worked very well. I recently started using the subscription service from Amazon and the past 2 orders I noticed not only was the packaging different and the tubes much harder to puncture, but the product itself smells different. My cats are scratching and licking like the medicine didn't work. I will cancel my subscription service and see if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product like it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: This would be a 0 stars if there was that option. I have been using this product for years. The last two batches, 4 capsules were totally ineffective. I have a short hair and a long hair. Both were treated per instruction, exactly as written. Over the last two doses for each cat, there was no reduction in fleas. My cats never stopped digging at the little pests. These are two very healthy, well fed and maintained cats. They are not flea infested mangy alley cats. But there was no reduction in the fleas that seem to be bothering my cats. So something has changed in the formula, as this stuff just doesn't work anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My *indoor* cat had fleas bad. She was laying around miserable, tearing huge clumps of her hair out and having a really hard time of it. One spot treatment didn’t work, another made her sick. I was afraid to try again but was desperate, something had to give. After reading the reviews, I bought a single tube. It worked!!!! It didn’t make her sick (made her pretty angry but she hates the spot treatment being applied. She got over it. ), it killed the fleas and now, two treatments in, her hair has grown back in thick and glossy and soft. This stuff works!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pam Seabolt

customer_reviews.title: Fleas Be Gone
customer_reviews.text: Much to my dismay, my cat came home with fleas after a visit to the vet. Sigh. WHAT I LIKE: 1. Easy to use. Just squeeze the little tube between the shoulder blades 2. Pre-measured tubes help with the perfect dose 3. Very effective (I have tried other brands and they didn't work this well) 4. Lasts the full month (unlike the 2 weeks the other brand worked) WHAT I WISH: I wish it was less expensive, but it does work. MY RATING: 5 Stars WOULD I BUY IT AGAIN: Absolutely RANDOM UNRELATED FACT: Every time you lick a USPS stamp, you ingest about 10 percent of a calorie. British stamps, however, contain about 5.9 calories. Israeli stamps are kosher.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. M.

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Frontline
customer_reviews.text: This is the product that I use on my very large cat...like 19 pounds worth of kitty. It works great, and when she and I are outside, she plays in the bushes in the yard and garden; she does not have fleas or ticks when we come back into the house. I also like this product better than Frontline because with that medication, my cat foamed at the mouth and would get dilated pupils and act like she were drunk. With advantage, this allergic reaction does not happen!
customer_reviews.author: M C

customer_reviews.title: MY CAT NOW HAS A RASH!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 4-year old cat is very healthy and active. He doesn’t have any disease and didn’t suffer from any type of illness. I used to use the Frontline but I thought it’d be a good try to switch since this is a popular one. I applied this product yesterday to him and he now has a rash on his neck. This is heartbreaking and I have no idea how this happened! I never saw anything like this happened to him.. It’s on the area where he can’t lick so I doubt the rash is from the licking. I will go see a vet.. such a disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Elle Y

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product! Did nothing to get rid of the fleas and left a bald spot on the back of my cat's neck.
customer_reviews.author: G. Marty

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are both disabled and broke just to put it mildly. We spent a good chunk of change on this product for our two miserable kitties and k9 advantix for our dog and none of them have worked to rid them and our house of the fleas. Years ago these products worked, now? We should have went with a different product. Now we are out the money and still have fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Irvine

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a flea problem in my house for months after bringing in a stray and wanted to get something to help the cat while I treat my home. I had tried Frontline and it did nothing at all. One month later I applied Advantage and have not seen more than one flea on her instead of dozens despite the fact that I'm still treating the house. She's still scratching around her face, but I think she's scratching old bites and I can't expect her to have none due to the state of the house, so overall I'm very impressed. She's even obsessed with sleeping in the box it came in. I recommend this a thousand times over Frontline!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Marie

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine, but buy with caution
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I went through my vet and bought more advantage which they guaranteed was authentic...cat still has fleas. It’s likely my amazon order was authentic, for some reason the fleas were resistant to this. Good luck! I bought online and noticed a week later my cat still had fleas - which in a decade of using advantage, I’ve never had happen. I asked my vet what steps I should take next and they informed me a lot of products on amazon are fakes, thus why they don’t work. Chinese manufacturers make it look authentic but it’s fake. Be careful!
customer_reviews.author: Nebu10us

customer_reviews.title: No longer effective
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what you did to the formula, but this didn’t work AT ALL. I ordered this in December, it didn’t work. I bought a different brand a few days later and it worked great. I bought this again out of habit a few days ago and it didn’t work AGAIN! Don’t waste your money. This no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Best product! And this is the REAL DEAL. Much trouble w/Ebay sellers. THANK YOU SO MUCH AMAZON!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Real Advantage II! I say "real" because I had recently bought a 4 pack through an Ebay seller. Treated one large cat(outdoor cat), twice on my small female(2-small cat treatments=1 large tube), once, then a week later, as recommended if still fleas. Never had done before? One large tube split for 4 kittens(w/medical syringe), 1 left. FLEAS EVERYWHERE LIKE NEVER BEFORE! LUCKILY I GOT A REFUND! Before that another seller sent w/2 empty tubes(sealed), other 2 fine.. Desperate for THE REAL DEAL, I ORDERED FROM AMAZON AS SELLER. EXCELLENT! MY CATS BACK TO NORMAL, NO FLEAS IN 24 HRS! ALWAYS BUYING FROM AMAZON AS THE SELLER!!! THANK YOU SO MUCH! ORDERING MORE SOON!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Turk

customer_reviews.title: Didnt kill fleas. Left huge bald spot on kitty
customer_reviews.text: So we live in the deep south where no matter what you will have to be preventative about fleas. My poor cat was getting eaten alive. The dog was fine. She was on a different medication. I gave my cat this in the hopes it would clear up his fleas that were badly irritating his skin. Not only has it not worked, but he has a HUGE bald spot on the back of his neck where I put this. I took him to the vet and now he is taking an oral medication while his skin clears up. Too bad. Was really hoping this would work.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Beland

customer_reviews.title: Tiny pet was not burned.
customer_reviews.text: As a first time pet owner, I was anxious buying thing seeing all the poor animals in the review photos. I bought this hoping my Juji would not get a reaction and she didn’t. Juji is about 10lbs and up. She isn’t chunky but has a tiny belly. I placed this right where it was supposed to go and she is 100% fine. I don’t know if other people are getting bad batches but I will update if she gets a burn. This was easy to apply and I might buy again depending on how the other doses react to her skin the next month. Here is a picture of my Juji afterwards completely safe and snuggly.
customer_reviews.author: Madiikins

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product for my cats. After arriving and applying this product to my cats I received and email from Amazon stating that this product is not true...to discard and stop use immediately!!! After a couple days I combed my cat for flees and still found one or two here and there. It did not work!! After a disturbing notification from Amazon I was concerned for my pets. Thankfully they are all fine!! I was never offered a refund or anything. I will never purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: LACY WILT

customer_reviews.title: It works for my cat? :)
customer_reviews.text: Every cat is different in regards to what works and their side effects just like humans but this stuff works wonders for my cat! He was scratching religiously day and night and we had recently moved. He was leaving red blood dots everywhere, our sink, toilet, floor etc. we knew we had to do to something. This took his fleas away within 24hrs. And now I can say he is flea free. No more bell scratching sounds, red blood dots everywhere. Awesome stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Alexx

customer_reviews.title: Dud?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always used this brand and it’s worked wonderful every time but it seems the batch I received was ineffective. I don’t believe I can return it because I already used 1 of 2 doses. Upset I wasted my money. (We treat our carpets for fleas once a month as well when treating our cat, so it’s been under control for a long time but with this faulty dose Kiwi is itching like crazy and absolutely covered with fleas.) I don’t know what to do now because I don’t want to expose her to more pesticide.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend! Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy. My cat was poisoned. He's fine now (3 days and 300$ later) but what do I see on his toe? A flea! He hasnt been outside! Zero stars. Don't recommend. I do recommend that you Just go to the vet and get revolution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WARNING! BAD PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write bad reviews unless it is really really really bad. I've used Advantage in the past on my other cats, and this never happened. I've attached pictures to this review. My poor babies' fur came out after using this product. On top of that, my angel, Tiger Lily's skin is inflamed now. I feel awful that she's going to have to deal with this for the next week. I'd give zero stars if I could. I'm leaving this review as a warning to pet owners.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah R. Embry

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Advantage 2 just doesn't work anymore. I used to use Advantage to help protect my indoor cats since fleas can get it on pants and shoes. Since the beginning of 2019, it seems like this stopped working to protect my cats. They were still getting fleas and itching. We treated our home and gave our cats baths and Capstar and treated them again and they still got fleas again. So we recently change the medication and now we have no problem with fleas anymore. Advantage 2 just doesn't work anymore with fleas- some vets have mentioned fleas getting resistant to medicine.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Absolute godsend.
customer_reviews.text: This was the third topical treatment I tried for my cat's fleas issue - the first two were inexpensive non name brands I got at a department store and neither worked, so I decided to try the name brand. I couldn't be happier with how well this worked for my cat. Seemingly immediately after applying it, I could tell he was scratching much less, and in days, he was no longer scratching at all. Every month I apply it, it works just as well. Can't recommend highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: O. Albretsen

customer_reviews.title: Barely worked
customer_reviews.text: My cat has a serious flea allergy and was terribly miserable after getting outside a few times. Even though I couldn't afford it I ordered a 2 dose pack for this cat and my two larger kittens. The allergic cat seems to have fewer bites but more keep appearing so it is not very effective. I used the other dose on my two young cats and after a week I am still seeing fleas. I had been told this was the most effective drops but this was certainly an expensive trial run for me. So glad I didn't get the larger pack this time. I definitely won't be using this expensive product again!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui Marlin

customer_reviews.title: This does not work.
customer_reviews.text: This used to work well on my cats and ferrets, but does not work at all now. Something in the product is different and/or fleas has become immune to this product. I also bought a product at Sam's with the same ingredients and it did not work either. Beware, that this is a lot of money to pay for something that doesn't work. Amazon refunded me for the last purchase I bought last month. They did this on their own without me asking or doing a review. I bought this product in Sept.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Midkiff

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: I should've listened to the negative reviews but sometimes the same situation doesn't always apply to everyone. I got this Monday and put it on my cat right away. I let him out after keeping in inside until I find something to help him for fleas and ticks. This didn't help. He had a tick on him today. If anyone know of something that will help him please feel free to share because he likes to be outside but I can't have him get fleas or ticks.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Beware of this dangerous product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is extremely dangerous for your dog!! Be careful when using this, as it has very adverse side effects and numerous potential reactions. Our dog had fleas, so we used the advantix on him. After about 24 hours, he started biting and licking himself to the point of causing horrible hot spots, which he had never had before!!! Called the Bayer vet line and the representative informed me that the product can create a tingling sensation that may cause your dog to feel uncomfortable. Spent $50 on a product we can no longer use...and now way over that price on vet bills and medical supplies for our poor dog.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wolak

customer_reviews.title: Product Sold is Not Legit
customer_reviews.text: This is clearly a knock-off product. I had been applying it regularly to my cat when he experienced a flea infestation. I realized that since I purchased the most recent box of six, he's had fleas. I purchased more Advantage II from Petco because I trust them as a seller more, and the product even feels different. For example, the seal on the tube is much more tight. And, there is a lot more liquid inside the tube. I didn't realize the difference until I purchased legit product. I don't believe this Advantage II is the real deal. I'm frustrated that Amazon would sell this product to pet owners without regulating it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. DeHaan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to switch from Vectra to Bayer because of packaging problem. When I gave my 8 year old and 12 year old cats their treatments they immediately got glassy eyed, started slobbering and throwing up. They never had a reaction to the Vectra. Since it was too late to get a refund so I was out the $60.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Works for 2 weeks....too expensive to upkeep.
customer_reviews.text: the good thing is it does work... but only seems to really control the fleas for about 2 weeks on my cats and ferrets rather than the "one month " and trust me I am applying it correctly. Even thought that maybe it was user error on my part but went over it with my vet and online tutorials and still only seems to work for around 2 weeks. The price of this product really needs to.go down to become affordable for loving pet owners who want to give animals their best life flea-free.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply. No Mess.
customer_reviews.text: Love that this doesnt leave a huge mess on the back of my cat! It doesnt smell as horrible as others either and seems to use less product to get the job done. We didnt have fleas to begin with so i cant say if it works on them or not. But i suppose not having a flea problem is a good sign!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha Espenschied

customer_reviews.title: Took months to work
customer_reviews.text: Really not sure how to feel about this one. My cat is indoors only and I keep the house spotless so I’m guessing a dog visitor brought fleas in. I only wanted to use this product because I was so afraid my cat would get sick from side effects of other brands. Luckily he was okay with every application but it took MONTHS for the fleas to finally go away. My vet said that eggs live for a few months so that was expected but given how clean my house is I expected this to work a lot better
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Advantage has the advantage
customer_reviews.text: As a longtime user of Frontline I've noticed a decrease in effectiveness over the past 18 months or so. My last purchase was no more effective than tap water. I switched over to Advantage and bingo! the cats were greatly relieved by the next day and the fleas have not re-infested. This stuff works.
customer_reviews.author: Jerseygirl

customer_reviews.title: A bit of advise for large cat breeds...
customer_reviews.text: I have a large cat so i buy the 9lbs and over Advantage 2. Well it stopped working on him about 2 weeks after i put the whole tube on. He was miserable and i thought id have to find something new until i read a review from a woman who used half the tube twice a month! I tried it and it works! I just wanted to pass on the Very Helpful info. Advantage still Rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer O.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZON ADVERTIZED WRONG!  DOES NOT PROTECT AGAINST TICKS!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Idaho, ticks are an issue here, more-so then fleas. I bought this for ticks. The headline next to the AMAZON TAG READS: for "cat flea and tick treatment". IT IS NOT FOR TICKS, and did not protect my 2 cats from ticks. I finally read the box closely and it doesn't state ticks, but Amazon advertising does say its for "ticks" I am so disappointed of the misleading add and now Amazon won't let me return unused portion; it took me too long to figure out the problem. I did buy a different one, another 55.00+ dollars, and was stuck with the other box. VERY DISAPPOINTED OF THE MISLEADING ADVERTISEMENT BY AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: It kills the fleas
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, it’s easy to apply. Im not sure what I dislike of it. I think it would be if it didn’t kill the fleas. I’m sure that it does. But, there could be chance it’s not. Tampering, switching the true medication and leaves the fake in the box. Laundering money, stealing the items for there selves. People are scared to death of this. Because, our pets will scratch there’s selves to death, that’s CRUEL, and hateful😥. They understand what’s wrong our pets look up to us to take care of them. I hope this situation never happens in our CO. That the world loves to shop at.😿. They count on us. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: MaryJane Hoad

customer_reviews.title: We are currently caring for 16 cats. The 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: We are currently caring for 16 cats. The 5 stray kittens we just caught brought in fleas. I kept them separate until I could bathe them with Dawn clear dishwashing soap per pet store advice but apparently not all fleas died. Never had a flea problem before. I used the appropriate size dose based on weight for each kitten and cat one week ago. There are more fleas on them today than before applying the treatment. Requesting a refund. Also, one of the older/bigger cats is losing hair at the site of the application. See photo attached.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Butler

customer_reviews.title: No no no no!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Doesnt work at all. I bought this brand based on the reviews and my cat still has fleas constantly biting him over a month later. Mind you im using this in combination with flea baths. Flea bath, wait for cat to dry, then application. In lieu of all my efforts, the latest flea bath (3rd) in 6 weeks has produced several full grown fleas. Bayer Advantage II, you werent worth my cat's litter.
customer_reviews.author: RavenArndt

customer_reviews.title: No longer the itchy and scratchy show . . .
customer_reviews.text: The fur-kid had gotten a bad case of the flees. Flee treatment can be quite pricy, but (obviously) I wanted something safe, as he's far more spoiled than the average person could ever dream of being. After pouring over reviews, I found this product: by far, most of the reviews on this flee treatment reflect no side effects; so I said a prayer, crossed my fingers and toes, and applied. I held my breath, watched through clinched eyes, paced back and forth, waited for something to happen, and when nothing did, finally let out the breath I'd been holding. No side effects here folks: well, other than the fact he stopped scratching! He's happy, I'm happy; money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: JaneDoe

customer_reviews.title: BEST Flea control - worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: ADVANTAGE has long been known as the leader in flea control. This product works wonders, and works quickly. If used on a regular basis, then you're not going to deal with fleas at all. But, if it's been awhile since you've used flea control and so now you have fleas, this works quickly, effectively, no scent, and very easy to apply. Don't balk at the expense, because the best flea products are not inexpensive and this one here, is worth it's cost. As always, thank you for reading my review and if you find it helpful, click on the word HELPFUL below!
customer_reviews.author: Miss K

customer_reviews.title: Burned off my cats hair overnight and left a bald spot
customer_reviews.text: This burned through my cats hair all the way to the skin. I applied it around 8pm and the next morning his hair was gone. I have called Bayer and they admitted this can happen in some cats. I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ty35

customer_reviews.title: This has not worked at all
customer_reviews.text: I hate putting chemicals on my animals but have had trouble finding a natural product that works to keep the ticks off. I went ahead and bought this very popular, well-rated chemical brand. I have since pulled 4 ticks off one cat and both cats still have signs of having fleas bothering them. I will be asking for a refund to buy the vet recommended Bravecto (unless you guys have recommendations!)
customer_reviews.author: K. C. Herbel

customer_reviews.title: Works great for larger cats
customer_reviews.text: Switched to this from Frontline Plus. Had a flea problem and couldn't figure out why since I treat my cats once a month. Switched to this since it said it was for large cats (one of mine is 20lbs) and it is more effective. Has a strong chemical order when first applied and the cats are too thrilled with it but does work. I have been using it for several months and they have not had any reactions or skin issues with it. Would recommend if you have a large cat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: San Diego seems to have some mutant fleas that defy most flea treatments. Our cats are indoors always, but the dog does love his walks. We had a heck of time keeping the fleas at bay with other products from Hartz, Advantix, even Frontline. This did the trick! Do pay attention to the weight of your animal and the dosage...it does matter. Don't cheap out as we tried to do because what you buy ultimately won't work. You can't beat this price when it comes to effectiveness and peace of mind, and it is by far a lot cheaper than other products out there that don't work as well. P.S. we have 3 indoor mature cats.
customer_reviews.author: LALLAW

customer_reviews.title: Skip this junk. Get some real stuff.
customer_reviews.text: MOST of these are nothing but irritants to the fleas. Put this on your cat and the little buggers get all worked up and bite even harder. I seriously think that all I accomplished for $50 was agitating the bugs. Best advice, go to your vet and get prescription strength. I was advised to use Revolution+ and it did the job.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Hoit

customer_reviews.title: Good flea prevention
customer_reviews.text: Fat cat approves! Rudy likes to go outside every once in awhile, and this flea med ensures that he isn't bringing in unwanted pests back in the house. Twist off the cap, put the pointed side of the cap on the top of the tube to pop open the tube, and squeeze the medication between the shoulder blades where the cat cannot lick it. Rudy has never had a negative reaction to this medication, and it keeps him flea free!! Will continue to purchase. I always get the multipack so it lasts 4 months. Good med, and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Connie O

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value and Will Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: As good as Revolution but not as expensive and doesn't require prescription. Works very well. No bad side effects for my kitty. It's easier than Revolution to open. Pull off the top, turn upside down and and press into tube, and it is ready. No scissors needed and no top flying off to find later. When my boy is eating, head down, neck exposed and paying no attention to me, I just squeeze it onto his neck. OK, for the next few meals he eats sideways and watches me closely but he gets over it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work at all
customer_reviews.text: I have four cats, two use the under 9lbs dosage of andvantage II and two use the over 9lbs dosage. It been two weeks and I'm still finding fleas on my cats. If it did anything at all, i can't tell.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: It actually works
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect this to work because my vet said that over the counter flea meds loose their effectiveness and my cats needed that BRAVECTO but she was wrong because this worked like a charm. Even cleared up the skin problem they get with the fleas. I'm impressed. It was super easy to apply, even to my sassy cat you can't get hold of easily. Very pleased customer.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but the best for our fluffy princess
customer_reviews.text: This flea stuff works better than the other brand, and better than the even more expensive sh* that the vet tries to sell me at every visit. Getting it in the right spot on a highly suspicious, vindictive cat is another matter. Sure, I can bribe her with a plate of fresh caught Alaskan salmon, but after I zap her with the money shot, I get the look of betrayal that I know will later result in a steaming pile in my dress shoes or the middle of the bed. Because that’s how cats roll. Next pet will be a photo of a goldfish.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cheney

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: This just did not work. Fleas again within an week and not a heavy infestation. Packaging doesn’t look quite right. There is a space in between the Larg and e on what should say large cat. I’m not confident this is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Not Fleas? But Does The Job.
customer_reviews.text: I have a kitty who suddenly started scratching and tearing her fur out, like she was itchy all over. We went to the vet a few times and couldn’t determine what is wrong, and nothing in the environment changed, so it is still a mystery. Also no sign of fleas in my place and my other cat is perfectly fine. Out of desperation, I just tried this treatment. For some reason, the itching went way down. We’re on our second month using this and so far, so good. No side effects that I’ve seen, except that she is a much happier little kitty!
customer_reviews.author: AVT

customer_reviews.title: It’s a tube of juice...
customer_reviews.text: It’s the liquid version. Unlike the dogs review I just did, the cat was more a pain. Mainly the cat itself. So it’s a lot of liquid for in between the shoulders. It works way more slowly than I anticipated- the dog saw relieve in 24 hours the cat on the other hand.. it’s day two and it/ rather we don’t see to much of a relief yet... fingers crossed. We see the vet next month and hoping to get him on an biannual shot- used it before and works great! I’m
customer_reviews.author: Dashai

customer_reviews.title: Seems to do its job.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working. First time using this one. The fleas became immune to the advecta for cats. I see a difference in just 2 days. Her coat is softer and the flea bites are healing already. She did vomit a day after the dose but not sure if it's related because she does vomit occasionally when she gets hungry. Hopefully it will hold up for the month!
customer_reviews.author: Chance Savant

customer_reviews.title: Really stopped the fleas and no bad reaction from either of our two cats.
customer_reviews.text: After several years of being cat parents to two cats that mostly live inside with limited daytime outside time, they suddenly became flea infested. We've had them for four and five years (adopted when they showed up and told us they owned us now). Never a flea and never before treated. We started this after a single application of an adult flea killer. Within a couple of days, they stopped all scratching and the only fleas have been an occassional one we see. After a couple of weeks, we are not seeing any fleas on the cats or around the house.
customer_reviews.author: JoeInTampa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work - SW Washington
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product on my cats in the summer for years. For some reason this did not work this year. I put Advantage II on my 2 cats on August 31st and just flea combed them (Sept 7th) and pulled 6+ very alive fleas off each cat. I have been vacuuming every other day and washing their bedding. I put spray flea killer on stuff I can't wash. I really shouldn't have been able to pull any fleas off of them. :( I guess I will have to try something else now.
customer_reviews.author: TARA CARLIN

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for a few days
customer_reviews.text: I was very hopeful while buying this product considering the misery me and my cat were in . So I cleaned my apartment, vacuumed everything, washed all the laundry and clothes , gave my cat a bath with an anti flea shampoo and then applied it according to instructions. For the first week everything was good but right after that I started waking up with bites and the cat started scratching again . I used a flee comb on the cat and pulled out 4 fat fleas . Not sure what i did wrong but it was a disappointment . The 2 stars are cuz atleast it worked for 5-7 days
customer_reviews.author: Black

customer_reviews.title: Bayer Advantage - A Name You Can Trust
customer_reviews.text: We've been using Bayer Advantage II for our cat for over a decade and he has never shown any adverse reactions to it. This including things like localized swelling, rashes, hair loss at the application site, and general irritation. Our cat takes this medicine very well and has never been infested by fleas. He is mainly an outdoor cat and chances of flea infestations are higher compared to house cats, but as I said, he has stayed completed flea free and healthy. For this reason, I highly recommend Bayer Advantage to all my family and friends who own cats and dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Muntaser Zaheer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if maybe I was one of the people that got a counterfeit, but this did not work at all. I even did it every week on each of my cats (the max you can do) and the fleas were still alive while one cat got a reaction. The collars seem to work a lot better by this same brand, but I bought them off petco to avoid a counterfeit.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Fleas gone in 2 days
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old indoor cats got fleas for the 1st time ever this year. I ordered Frontline plus first and it did absolutely nothing after 3 weeks. I then ordered Bayer Advantage II and the fleas were gone 2 days after application. Both products are ridiculously expensive but at least the Bayer product works.
customer_reviews.author: Mike King

customer_reviews.title: No expiration date, otherwise use in small batches to ensure no reaction
customer_reviews.text: Other than no expiration date, this seems to work. I used on my Himalayan cat and I used a small batch to test on her neck to make sure no allergic reaction. I was nervous with all the bad reviews on here, so I applied a small amount from vial, waited two days for no reaction, then applied some more. I did this in 3 batches to use the entire vial. My cat tolerated it fine and had no adverse events. I haven't found any fleas yet (but she is an indoor cat, but around dogs that do go out).
customer_reviews.author: Sadie M

customer_reviews.title: Not that good
customer_reviews.text: So many reviews were good that this kept the flesh away. Well here in west Texas that is not the case. Now it does work a little better than the cheap stuff at the store but it only works for a few days to kill fleas & then it's back to the same. Theres so many stray cats around here & our cats refuse to stay in the house. So I am either giving flea baths or trying different flea meds. So far nothing works not even this. I put it on weekly and still fleas keep coming back.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us
customer_reviews.text: We have five cats and never in the last two years of living here had an issues with fleas . Until recently . We all began itching and founds a few fleas on all 5 cats. We gave them capstar and the second day we applied this product . After a few days we are still seeing live fleas coming off of them. It’s not bad but still Shouldn’t be seeing anything . After all the work to defies our house and cats . According to this box it should be working and it isn’t . My cats are inside only .
customer_reviews.author: MomAndADad

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several different flea drops. Fleas are just getting resistant to all these drops now, so I try to switch them up. I'm low budget so price is always something to consider and these are great price for their effectiveness. They're not going to kill every flea and egg. You can't just buy drops and expect to get rid of your flea infestation. But they do help kill off what's on the cats at the time. They do not keep fleas off an entire month though. There are hardly any drops in the tube, so I felt better just cutting the whole end off the tube to make sure they were getting the full dose.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: These keep fleas away from cats and do not irritate the cats' skin or cause stomach upset.
customer_reviews.text: After years of no fleas, both of our mostly inside cats suddenly came down with a serious flea infestation. We treated them first with a quick killing medicine for adult fleas. With that done, we cleaned up bedding areas and treated both cats with Advantage II. No more fleas, and that was about a month and a half ago. Advantage II works as well as the much more expensive prescription product our veterinarian used to provide for a previous cat, but costs so much less and does not require a prescription.
customer_reviews.author: JoeInTampa

customer_reviews.title: Best product we have found for fleas on cats in North-central Florida
customer_reviews.text: We live in north-central Florida, where the fleas seem almost super-invincible. We have never found ANY product that works 100 percent, or for an entire month, but Advantage II comes the closest. Our indoor-only cats only occasionally battle a few fleas in the fourth week after treatment, but for the first three weeks each month, we usually never see more than one or two fleas among the three cats combined. This is by far the best result we've achieved with any flea product. (The Seresto collar for our dog worked MIRACLES, but we cannot put collars on the cats. If they cannot chew on their own, they chew on each other's...or lose them entirely.)
customer_reviews.author: kalebsmom

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I applied this when I noticed a single flea on one of my cats (they weren’t scratching yet and I couldn’t find any flea poop on them) It’s been 2 weeks and my cats have a bunch of fleas now. This product did not work. The only plus side was that my cats didn’t have a bad reaction to it...but a total waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Finally killed the darn fleas!
customer_reviews.text: I had tried literally everything under the sun to get rid of fleas on my pets and finally succeeded after treating all five of my animals for four weeks straight with Advantage II and once a month every month after that. This was of course in combination with treating my yard, my whole house, washing everything in hot water, bagging up extra pillows, blankets, rugs, etc., and combing my animals regularly. I know Advantage wouldn’t have done it all on its own but it was definitely the thing that gave my efforts a leg up and the thing that has kept the darn fleas away!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Joy Beals

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: We have been battling fleas for months. Tried several different medications, sprays, relentless vacuuming and cleaning everything. We couldn't get them to go away. Within 48 hours of putting this on, I have not seen a single flea on any of the cats, or anywhere else. This is more than worth the money! I will be purchasing it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: First off the difference between the small (.4) cat and large (.8) is the amount of medicine, otherwise it’s completely the same. This has always worked well on my kitty and we’ve never had any negative side effects happen to her. It always works fast and works the entire month, maybe over a month a bit as we never see new fleas if were a little late with the next month. We’ve only had an issue of a package getting lost once and Amazon was quick to refund for the lost package.
customer_reviews.author: APAndrooz

customer_reviews.title: Great product, been using for years!
customer_reviews.text: I've bee using Advantage on my cats for years. They are indoor cats, but they go out onto a catio that we built in the warm months. Advantage does not kill ticks, however, my cats haven't gotten ticks yet (we live in a small city, so we don't see a ton of those on our animals). My husband and I also foster cats who show up on our doorstep as strays - and Advantage has always been our go to. Works great to maintain fleas. I use it with Capstar for our newcomers (strays who we are just bringing in). Great product for keeping your home flea free!
customer_reviews.author: Justine P.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Skin Reactions
customer_reviews.text: Have used this stuff for years. For sone reason, both of our cats lost their fur at the application sites and had a scabbing skin reaction/chemical burn this last time. Suspecy the formula changed. Will not use this again.
customer_reviews.author: PO'ed

customer_reviews.title: NO, NO, NO. Fake.
customer_reviews.text: Made my cat sweat, throw-up, and did NOTHING for fleas... THERE WERE TYPOS IN THE INSTRUCTION SHEET
customer_reviews.author: SpiderGrrl

customer_reviews.title: My vet recommended this and Bayer is a top notch company but ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m on my second try with this product. Waiting for drops that Amazon sent me “gratis” because obviously couldn’t return the first purchase. My vet recommended this and Bayer is a top notch company but my cats still have fleas in spite of proper application 3 weeks age. In fact I believe they may be worse. I use a flea comb and see smaller fleas living and jumping. I deduce that the drops have killed adults but not the eggs they are supposed to kill as well. I’m living a mini nightmare here. Now I have to use a “bomb” and I feel those are drastic measures.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: May work if you dont have fleas that are resistant
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could say that Advantage worked for our 3 indoor cats, but just like with all the other popular brands, they still have fleas. I spoke to a vet who said the fleas in southern areas where the temps get extremely hot and humid are becoming resistant to the meds. I believe it. He said to try Revolution or Activyl. So if you live in an area where the fleas aren't immune to Advantage, it'll probably work great for you. If you're in the south, try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Forrester

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! My cat is still scratching himself after a few days!
customer_reviews.text: I made sure when I applied this product, that it went onto my cat's skin. I carefully read the instructions over and over to make sure I was doing it right. I did. Don't know why or how this has such high ratings. It did not work on my cat! He is still scratching himself! Poor thing. Luckily we did not get a reaction and he did not end up with a bald spot. Will not buy ever again! At least I got refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using the cheaper Pet Armour which suddenly wasn't cheap anymore. Also, the Pet Armour brand many times came with empty vials! So I ordered the Bayer Advantage II for Large Cats. THe vials always have plenty of product in them and did a much better job of keeping fleas and ticks off my outdoor cats that roam everywhere. My indoor cat is too small for the Bayer so I'll look for something else for her. But no more Pet Armour.
customer_reviews.author: BENGAL

customer_reviews.title: Fleas Fleas Fleas
customer_reviews.text: Got these for our 14 year old calico cat. I've always trusted this brand in the past. After this experience, I won't. The poor cat has scratched something fierce! And the fleas are treating her like an all night buffet. Tried to contact the com[any -- kept getting transferred to "someone who will be able to help you better" and being placed on hold. After being on hold for up to 35 minutes, it would start all over again. I can't sit with a phone to my year all day!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Santa

customer_reviews.title: Works well in conjunction with other products.
customer_reviews.text: This product helps keep fleas from my pets if I use another product in conjunction with it. Before treating my pets I give them a dose of Capstar. Capstar works within twenty minutes and kills fleas when they bite my pets. It works for 24 hours and totally rids them of fleas. The Advantage II then keeps the fleas off my pets. If your pet has fleas, you must get rid of the infestation first. You must also rid you home of fleas as well. I learned this process from my vet.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Bald spots!
customer_reviews.text: BE CAREFUL ABOUT BALD SPOTS. It didnt hurt my baby and it got rid if the fleas but my cat is overweight at maybe 20lbs? I have another cat who is very light so I got both the small cat and large cat doses, the small cat does worked fine and she didnt get a bald spot but the large dose gave my big baby a bald spot on her neck. She didnt seem uncomfortable but she lost some hair. It did grow back but just really be careful of the weight recommendations - I'm going to use the small cat doses from now on
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Graham

customer_reviews.title: A major don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: What is wrong with this stuff? I've been using it for years, now all of a sudden my cats have fleas just days after application. I've heard that the fleas have become resistant and I've been warned of counterfeit products being sold, even by reputable distributors. For the price we're paying for with this gunk, it is a swindle to offer it for sale. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hayner

customer_reviews.title: It does the job... check with your vet before using
customer_reviews.text: My favorite product for fleas control on cats.Combined with frequent vacuuming and a steamer. I use it on my indoor cat, and put it on the couple of strays that live in my backyard. Even if your cat already have fleas, this product used monthly will solve the problem and is better than spray, dips shampoo etc. One important thing is treat the environment to prevent re-infestation. Since cats can be very sensitive to certain insecticide ingredients (including the so called "natural" stuff) always check with your vet before starting a treatment and using products in the areas your pet lives.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: This had to be a fake product. I've used this for many years and it wipes out fleas like nobody's business. I used this and nothing happened. I used another dose about 10 days later thinking it must be a bad infestation and no effect. Extremely disappointed as I love the convenience of buying on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: H. Baqi

customer_reviews.title: This worked when nothing else had!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 large indoor cats that end up with fleas each summer. We read the reviews on many and decided to try this. We were careful to run a line between their shoulder blades (rather than all in one spot) and they are flea free and have no skin irritations from the product. We are at the 2 week mark and they have scratched on rare occasion. We will continue the monthly treatment through the hot months while fleas are active outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: DarcyLMz

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: It has been three weeks since administering the first dose of this product. In addition, we have been spraying carpets with Raid Flea Killer Carpet and Room Spray and vacuuming. I can say that I believe the problem has gotten worse, not better. The carpet spray seems to work, but my two cats are still suffering and I find fleas on me after interacting with them every single time. This product does. not. work.
customer_reviews.author: D0M1N10N

customer_reviews.title: recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats, and they go outside, that's why they have fleas. Luckily I saw this product which solved my problem. I've read all reviews and I felt a little anxious, so I used Elizabeth collar after applying, and then I put the cats in different rooms. None of the cats had any bad reactions, and it worked well for three of them. I gave 4 stars because the product is so expensive, overall recommended. edit: Yesterday I checked my cats again and I saw the fleas, I changed my rating, sorry.
customer_reviews.author: mL g.

customer_reviews.title: Dead cat
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give it a negative review. After moments of putting it on my cat, she started panting, had 2 seizures, screamed and died. It was a horrible, unforgettable experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: made cat bald
customer_reviews.text: Having had dozens of cats in my lifetime, an occasional flea is not uncommon even for all indoor cats. So instead of the vet, this time I tried this over the counter. Never again. Bald spot appeared next day and continued to grow. Luckily second smaller car is fine, so it wasn’t improper application nor weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product did not work
customer_reviews.text: I used this about one week ago after finding fleas on my 2 cats for the first time in several years. I have used it before with success, but this time it did not work. I also bought the Small Cat variety for my smaller cat, they both still have fleas. Looks like the fleas have become resistant. I bought four doses for each cat - total waste of money. I did some research and it looks like this has begun to occur in the last year or so. If you look carefully you will see that many positive reviews are from several years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Vegan1278

customer_reviews.title: Apply to skin follow instructions!
customer_reviews.text: NO FLEAS ON KITTY! After applying I check outdoor kitty with flea comb and he is flea free! Make sure to buy the right dosage for the weight of your kitty. MAKE SURE TO APPLY TO SKIN, NOT ON FUR OR ITS NOT EFFECTIVE! FOLLOW ALL INSTRUCTIONS!
customer_reviews.author: Buzzy

customer_reviews.title: Works Ok
customer_reviews.text: I've recently switched to a more affective product recommended my cat's Vet. However, when I was using this product there was a difference in the amount of fleas that my cat would have in her fur, but over all it's not quite as affective as other brands for the same money. As always speak to a vet before using any chemical like this, it can cause serious injury or death in some cases with cats.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this on my 2 cats for several years. until this order, a dose left a wet spot on the back of their neck that was very wet and the size of a silver dollar. this batch leaves a spot that that is smaller than a dime and only a little damp. I opened 1 and emptied it into a small glass, there was only a single, small drop. less than a tenth of the meds for the same price. I will find a new company to deal with. these people are putting our pets health in danger for more profit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert c Means

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I wanna say it works great but I still have one cat that has been scratching constantly and losing patches of fur. He’s black so of course it’s more noticeable. I’ve used this for years and have purchased either from my vet or a pet store but only recently purchased from Amazon. Don’t understand why the one cat is still scratching but I did order Capstar (think that’s what it’s called) and it’s an oral med and seems to have calmed the scratching way down .
customer_reviews.author: MeDeeLee21

customer_reviews.title: Works About A Week, Then They Return
customer_reviews.text: It appeared to work quickly, but within a week I noticed fleas crawling all over the back of my cat. Including directly on the area I had applied the product. After reading the box I saw you could do a 2nd application sooner for worse-than-normal cases. Same situation though, within a week the fleas had returned in full force. I will be switching to another brand immediately and have already tossed away the remaining applications from this box.
customer_reviews.author: FrankTheTank

customer_reviews.title: Not so much for Texas fleas
customer_reviews.text: This product did not consistently kill or prevent fleas on my catsuit my dog. It worked well for half of the cats but not the other half, and did not work at all on the dog (I used the dog version for him). And that’s along side bombing and vacuuming the house, bathing and combing the babies, and treating the yard prior to application. Round 3 coming up, and we will be using another product.
customer_reviews.author: I Hate Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Not working really!?
customer_reviews.text: I’m sick and tired of giving my cat flea treatment and she keeps kicking, scratching and itch. So I had to go from small to large cat dosage (she is 7 pounds without her tail) so I hope this works and won’t be toxic!!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Esplin

customer_reviews.title: Better protection and easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me because Frontline was not protecting my cats from fleas so i reached out for suggestions from other cat owners. I think mine had become immune to the Frontline? Either way, not only do I believe this works better, but when i apply it to my 2 cats, they dont even know it. It has very little to no odor, and the applicator doesnt poke my cats like the other. I no longer have to struggle and be a sneaky sleuth to apply this. Each cat will lie next to me and its as easy as pie now.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jackson

product_meta.title: Bayer Animal Health Advantage II 2-Dose Flea Prevention and Treatment for Large Cats, Over 9 Pounds
product_meta.description: Style:6 doses| Size:Over 9 lbAdvantage II topical flea treatment and prevention for large cats over 9 pounds is a veterinarian-recommended, monthly application that kills fleas through contact, so they don't have to bite your cat to die. The protection of Advantage II kills fleas in multiple life stages, including eggs, larvae and adults, effectively breaking the flea life cycle to control existing flea infestations on your cat and prevent further infestations. This 6-dose cat flea treatment comes in a convenient topical liquid that is easy to apply and fragrance free. A single application of Advantage II cat flea treatment for large cats starts working in 12 hours and keeps killing fleas for up to 30 days. Even indoor cats need flea protection because humans and other pets can bring fleas into your home. Advantage II is also available in a formula for dogs. Fight the misery of biting fleas with the help of Advantage II 6-month flea prevention and treatment for large cats.
feature_bullets: 6-month supply of advantage II topical large cat flea prevention
Easy-to-apply and pre-measured flea treatment application tubes, fragrance-free and waterproof after 24 hours
Advantage II large cat flea prevention kills fleas through contact, meaning fleas don’t have to bite your cat in order to die
Starts working within 12 hours and protects your cat for up to 30 days. Kills fleas in multiple life stages; Eggs, larvae and adults to break the flea life cycle
Vet recommended, fragrance free and designed specifically to treat and prevent fleas on cats

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
